 This is an excellent opportunity to work as a Commercial Data Scientist, joining the Analytics team weekly in the office of this leading retail company based outside of Birmingham. With the chance to be the go-to data science professional part of a wider analytics team, this position would be perfect for someone looking to take on a new and exciting role.
 
THE COMPANY:
 This is a leading company in the retail industry, currently offering a wide range of products and services. Therefore, with this company's large database of customers and transactions, the Commercial Data Scientist will have a wealth of data to work with and work on, thus continuing to refine your skillset.
 
THE ROLE:

 As the Commercial Data Scientist, you will be joining the Commercial Planning team as well as facing into the wider Analytics function. You will also be working on exciting projects, such as:
 working on statistical modelling within the customer and commercial analytics space to provide insight, including regression, segmentation/clustering, and propensity modelling
 this includes regression models, prediction models and forecasting for customer behaviour as well as price elasticity and category analysis across the business
 building models from scratch, across neural networking, segmentation, regression

 
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
 As the Commercial Data Scientist, it is essential that you:

 Have excellent skills in SQL and R/Python
 Have experience in building and deploying analytical models from end to end
 Have experience in building regression and predictive models that can be built into the systems
 Have excellent communication skills for working with other teams and communicating with stakeholders across technical and non-technical backgrounds

 

SALARY AND BENEFITS:

 £45,000 - £55,000
 Bonus
 Car allowance
 Autonomy as the go-to data scientist within the commercial team
 Flexible working - preferably twice a week in office

 
HOW TO APPLY:
 Please register your interest by sending your CV to Alanah Chambers via the Apply link on this page.
 
Please note that there is no opportunity for sponsorship for this role.

Misión

Buscamos a un/a Data Scientist para el equipo de Analítica Avanzada de Santalucía Seguros que quiera formar parte de la transformación que se está llevando a cabo en el Grupo Santalucía. Queremos incorporar una persona que nos ayude a posicionarnos como un elemento core del negocio, aportando soluciones que tengan un impacto real en la compañía tanto desde el punto de vista interno de resultados económicos, como para el cliente, ya que es un punto clave en la visión de Santalucía gracias a una oferta de servicios diferenciales y de valor.

En el día a día contribuirá a hacer del equipo de Analítica Avanzada un área que ayude a resolver los diferentes problemas de negocio usando diferentes técnicas estadísticas, así como datos internos/externos que apoyen a la toma de decisiones y permitan resolver los diferentes retos que se planteen colaborando con el resto de Data Scientists del equipo.

Funciones

Liderar proyectos de Data Science tanto de manera individual como apoyado por otros miembros del equipo, así como por equipos de consultoría externos.

Colaborar con las personas responsables, tanto de su propia unidad como del resto de áreas de negocio y técnicas, en la definición y desarrollo del proyecto para asegurar el cumplimiento de plazos y expectativas, mediante la supervisión del mismo con el objetivo de cumplir los estándares comprometidos para los entregables, así como informando a las áreas implicadas tanto de avances como de posibles bloqueos que puedan surgir, adelantándose en la medida de lo posible a potenciales riesgos

Trabajar de la mano con todas las áreas de negocio y otras áreas stakeholders para entender el detalle del problema de negocio. Siempre teniendo en cuenta las particularidades del negocio asegurador mediante escucha activa en reuniones con los diferentes interlocutores de las unidades con las que se colaborará.

Analizar la información existente, así como proponer activamente nuevas aproximaciones para enriquecer dicha información, trabajando con conjuntos de datos potencialmente más aptos para la resolución de los retos de análisis a solventar.

Promover el uso de los datos dentro de la compañía, en base a las políticas internas de seguridad y de cumplimiento, y siempre en base a los estándares de calidad, seguridad y legalidad establecidos.

Aportar capacidades del tratamiento del dato usando diferentes técnicas, en base a los resultados obtenidos del análisis de la información (EDA) previamente realizado, con el objetivo de preparar la información para el posterior modelado.

Pensar de manera crítica para identificar el mejor conjunto de modelos/reglas/soluciones a probar para resolver el problema de negocio, así como de optimización de la solución a desarrollar gracias al diseño, implementación, y pruebas de los diferentes algoritmos candidatos, así como para desplegar los modelos desarrollados en entornos de producción.

Interpretar resultados, detectar puntos de mejora en los modelos y proponer estrategias alternativas de trabajo con los datos, así como transmitir los procesos realizados a perfiles técnicos, así como de negocio.

Definir KPIs con el fin de monitorizar la información, modelos desarrollados y diferentes drifts que puedan surgir, así como de métricas de gobierno de la calidad de la información.

Mantener, realizar un seguimiento y mejorar los modelos actuales.

Crear nuevos modelos de machine learning escalables y listos para la puesta en producción.

Documentar las soluciones generadas, para justificar las decisiones tomadas, y para presentar los procesos operativos diseñados.

Colaborar en los procesos de identificación, reunión y negociación con proveedores, incluyendo la definición de los requerimientos técnicos óptimos para el correcto desarrollo de los proyectos.

Requisitos

Titulación requerida – Licenciatura/Grado en Informática, Matemáticas, Físicas, Ingeniería u otra carrera técnica. Valorable doctorado en alguna de estas disciplinas.
Experiencia profesional de al menos 4 años en departamentos de ciencia de datos. Deseable conocimiento del sector finanzas/seguros.

Conocimientos avanzados matemáticos y estadísticos, y en técnicas de preparación de datos en bruto (incluyendo tratamientos de textos) y creación de modelos de Machine Learning de diferente tipología tales como series temporales, y modelos de regresión.

Conocimientos de tecnologías Cloud, Bases de Datos, visualización de la información, estadística, modelado, simulación de escenarios, programación (Python) y Big Data (Spark 3.x), SAS, SQL.

Experiencia en la realización de informes y cuadros de mando en herramientas de reporting.

Deseable experiencia con Databricks y MLFlow.

Au sein d'une équipe dédiée aux développements de solutions logicielles innovantes dans le secteur de la vente de spiritueux, votre première mission consistera à imaginer un protocole de benchmark de prix basé sur des ressources d'informations publiques. Afin d'améliorer le positionnement-prix de l'ensemble des gammes et produits, vous créerez un outil permettant la mise en place d'une mini-marketplace.
Contrairement au secteur de l'édition où un identifiant unique et très répandu (comme l'ISBN) existe, l'information sur les vins et spiritueux, tels que l'EAN, l'UDC ou le GTIN, ne sont pas systématiquement présents ni universellement reconnus sur l'intégralité des sites d'e-commerce. Afin de pallier cette limite technique et informationnelle, l'objectif sera d'utiliser des techniques à la frontière entre le traitement automatique des langues (NLP), l'image processing et le machine learning, voire le Deep Learning, afin de collecter de manière automatique sur internet les informations pertinentes concernant l'état du marché de la vente des vins et spiritueux.
Pour ce faire, il conviendra de créer un corpus et/ou un dictionnaire adapté à la recherche de mots-clés, et surtout de leur combinaison ordonnée, mais également la mise en place d'un processus automatisable de mise à jour de ce corpus et de son enrichissement régulier avec l'ensemble des données disponibles publiquement (internet, ou autre catalogue public à disposition).
Le but, in fine, étant d'identifier de manière unique l'ensemble des produits commercialisés et d'établir un processus d'appariement prix-nom précis, effectif et aisé à mettre à jour.
Diplôme d'école d'ingénieur ou universitaire, en lettres et applications quantitatives, sociologie appliquée, mathématiques appliquées, ou équivalents.
Expérience significative (5 ans et plus) dans le domaine de la Data Science. - Expérience dans le domaine de la recherche (Master Recherche / Phd.) appréciable.
Profil recherché : - Autonome - Curieux et pro-actif - Agile intellectuellement - Appétence pour le travail en équipe
Connaissances souhaitées : - Techniques d'apprentissage automatique et statistique - Expertise en NLP et Image Processing - Connaissances des modèles de Machine Learning basiques (régression linéaire et logistique, arbre de décision, SVM, plus proches voisins, k-means, etc.) - Maîtrise de Python et des librairies pertinentes (Beautifulsoup, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit-Image, OpenCV, Mahotas) - Appétence pour développement et l'intégration informatique -
Toute connaissance en modélisation de système de recommandation constituera un plus Langue : Bon niveau d'anglais souhaité (à minima être capable de lire de la documentation technique et académique en anglais)

Nos atouts pour y parvenir ?  Alternant(e) - Data scientist (H/F)

info_remote: Liebherr-Mining Equipment Colmar SAS - 430 reviews - Colmar (68)
description:
Le département Digital Services & Solutions a été créé en 2018 avec comme vocation de développer des services digitaux à destination des clients de Liebherr Mining : les exploitants miniers. Ces nouveaux services font partie intégrante de la stratégie de transformation digitale de Liebherr.
L’ambition est de fournir aux exploitants miniers les moyens d’optimiser leur performances opérationnelles (productivité, qualité, coûts,…) au travers de services et produits digitaux.
Liebherr Mining vous offre l’opportunité d’effectuer votre apprentissage pour développer plus avant les compétences déjà acquises tout en étant accompagné au quotidien par les membres d’une équipe jeune, dynamique et compétente. Vous contribuez également à la transformation digitale de notre entreprise.
Vos Missions
As part of our digital Service Scrum team, Liebherr Mining is currently looking for a trainee to work on Data Science topics as anomalies detection, activities detection, PCA, predictive maintenance,...
These Data Science research topics will rely on our Big Data platform that collect, clean and enrich a huge amount of IoT data from our machines: Hydraulic Excavators, Oversized Haulage Trucks, and Dozers.
This internship allows you to strengthen your knowledge and improve your skills on more up-to-date technologies.
You will be involved in our Data Scientists team and be able to participate actively in the realization of our research activities, that will help our customers, engineer, product manager, customer support, to better understand our machines operating performance and health in production environment.
Your skills in Applied Mathematics, Python, Notebooks, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning will be appreciated.
Finally, you must be meticulous in nature, be able to present your work and have a 'Team Player' spirit.
Vos Compétences
BAC +4 / BAC + 5 : Vous avez une appétence pour les nouvelles technologies et particulièrement l’exploitation des données, votre parcours vous a apporté des bases en développement logiciel et vous êtes à l’aise dans un environnement pluriculturel et dans les échanges avec des experts tant en français qu’en anglais.
Curieux et organisé(e), vous savez structurer vos actions pour atteindre vos objectifs et ceux de l’équipe.
The main technologies and methods that you will have to use are:
Collaborative tools : confluence/Jira/GitSQLPython for data science activitiesNotebooks (Jupyter and/or Zeppelin)Statistical analysisContinuous optimizationTime-Series analysisArtificial neural network
Notre offre
En venant chez Liebherr, vous intégrez un Groupe prospère et de renommée internationale où la culture d’entreprise est orientée sur les valeurs humaines. Nous vous offrons une expérience enrichissante avec les avantages sociaux d'une entreprise moderne et une rémunération basée sur la performance.
Avons-nous suscité votre intérêt ? Si c’est le cas, nous serions ravis de recevoir votre candidature en ligne. Si vous avez des questions, veuillez contacter Virginie LOOS à : 0033 3 69 49 22 02.
One Passion. Many Opportunities.
Une passion commune. Tant d’opportunités.
L'entreprise
Liebherr-Mining Equipment Colmar SAS produit une large gamme de pelles minières hydrauliques avec des poids en ordre de marche de 100 à 800 tonnes avec des capacités de godet allant jusqu'à 47,5 m³.

68025 Colmar/Cedex

company_name: MCO & centre de soins dentaires Pontchaillou
info_remote: MCO & centre de soins dentaires Pontchaillou - 35033 Rennes
description:
Descriptif
Le CHU de Rennes recherche un Ingénieur de Recherche ou Post Doctorant Data Scientist H/F spécialisé dans les méthodes d’apprentissage automatique appliquées aux données massives en santé.

Le CHU de Rennes, leader dans le domaine du Big Data en Santé avec sa solution innovante ehop (entrepôt et outil de fouille de données biomédicales), développe en lien avec les équipes de recherche une activité de traitement des données massives en santé.
Le centre de données cliniques (15 personnes) rassemble les équipes du Laboratoire Traitement du Signal et de l’Image (LTSI), de l’UMR Inserm 1099 et du CHU de Rennes.
L’équipe est composée d’ingénieurs de recherche et développement logiciel, de data scientists et de professionnels de santé spécialisés en informatique médicale qui conçoivent et développent des méthodes et outils d’intégration et de fouille de données massives en santé (Big Data).

Vos activités principales sont :

Développer au sein de l’équipe l’axe apprentissage automatique qui puisse répondre aux cas d’usages définis avec l’équipe médicale.Développer, implémenter et évaluer des méthodes d’apprentissage automatique pour tirer parti des larges volumes de données cliniques.Participer aux cycles R&D du logiciel eHOP, en lien avec l’équipe d’ingénieur : prospective/prototypage, évaluation, conception et développements, transfert industrielValoriser les travaux au travers de publications scientifiques dans des journaux et des conférences de références.Participer aux réponses d’appel d’offre recherche.

Profil recherché :

Formation, connaissances et aptitudes requises :


Formation Ingénieur/universitaire BAC+5
ou Doctorat spécialisé en mathématique, statistiques, apprentissage automatique/profondCapacité à conduire des études expérimentales, écriture scientifique
Capacité de communication dans un but d’efficacitéForte expérience en programmation et gestion de bases de données (relationnelles et noSQL).
Maîtrise de l’écosystème Big Data (Hadoop, Spark), traitements batch et/ou streaming, calcul GPU, framework Deep Learning (Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch).
Expertise d’au moins un langage parmi python, R.Une connaissance des entrepôts de données bio-médicales serait souhaitée.

Le poste, à temps plein, est à pourvoir en contrat d’un an (renouvelable)
Personne à contacter
Vous devez postuler en ligne sur le site du CHU de Rennes en déposant votre CV et votre lettre de motivation avant le 25 mai 2022.

Vous voudrez bien mentionner vos prétentions salariales ainsi que votre délai de préavis le cas échéant.

Vous pouvez consulter le profil de poste complet sur le site du CHU de Rennes

Email : churennes@accelerh.fr

IMKI
Start-up spécialisée dans l'Intelligence Artificielle générative (GAN), IMKI propose le premier service de Deep Learning dans le secteur de la culture permettant la génération d’expérience audiovisuelle immersive et spectaculaire.
Pour ce faire, IMKI développe ses propres architectures neuronales permettant la restauration et la valorisation des images animées pour les nouvelles technologies de visualisation telles que la réalité augmentée, la réalité virtuelle ou les expériences immersives.
Nous développons ainsi nos propres architectures GAN pour optimiser le processus de génération d’expérience immersive à partir de médias existants ou non.
En pleine croissance, nous cherchons à étoffer l’équipe de développement actuelle afin de poursuivre la croissance de la start-up.
IMKI s’inscrit dans le groupe museum-factory, leader dans l’expérience muséographique et culturelle.
Missions
Le ou la employé(e) aura pour principale mission le management et la supervision des équipes techniques, la définition de la roadmap et des choix des stacks techniques.
Les missions seront :
· Participer à la création de base de données adaptées au problème.
· Entraîner et optimiser les modèles IA.
· Participer à la validation des modèles entraînés en conditions réelles et suivre les performances en termes de robustesse, précision et temps de calcul.
· Rester à la pointe de l'état de l'art et de l'actualité scientifique et transmettre ses connaissances à l'équipe.
Profil
Doctorant (PhD) ou Maîtrise (Bac+5) avec spécialisation en Machine learning. Idéalement une première expérience de Deep Learning. Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies et l’Intelligence Artificielle. Dynamique, autonome et rigoureux(se). Bonnes connaissances générales des technologies, faculté d'adaptation, autonomie et esprit d'équipe. Être force de proposition et sensible aux processus d'ingénierie logiciel et à la Qualité.

Maîtrise ou doctorat en informatique
Bonne compréhension des bases du Machine Learning et du Deep Learning
Expérience de la mise en œuvre dans les algorithmes et les applications d'apprentissage automatique
Langage maitrisé : Réseaux de neurones convolutionnels et GAN, frameworks deep learning (TensorFlow et Pytorch), machine learning, python.
Sens du travail en équipe

Rémunération et Avantage
Poste en full remote possible
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDIStatut : Cadre
Salaire : à partir de 40 000,00€ par an

post_title: PhD Student - SAP Data Scientist CXS Cloud Service Intelligence team F/H
description:
Réquisition: 326414 Secteur de travail: Software-Design and Development Déplacement escompté: 0 - 10% Statuts de carrière: Étudiant Type d’emploi: Intern
 DESCRIPTION DE L’ENTREPRISE SAP a vu le jour en 1972, sur l'initiative d'une équipe de cinq collaborateurs désireux de créer quelque chose de nouveau. Ensemble, ils ont révolutionné le secteur des logiciels d'entreprise et réinventé les méthodes de gestion. Aujourd'hui, SAP se positionne en leader sur le marché des logiciels d'entreprise, mais nous restons fidèles à nos racines. C'est pourquoi nous concevons des solutions qui nourrissent l'innovation, favorisent l'égalité et multiplient les opportunités pour nos employés et nos clients, au-delà des frontières et des cultures. SAP apprécie l'esprit d'entreprise, encourageant la créativité et établant des relations durables avec nos employés. Notre personnel réfléchit la diversité et l'intégration: nous sommes conscients qu'il s'agit d'une richesse source de compétitivité à long terme et d'opportunités pour tous. Nous pensons qu'ensemble, nous pouvons transformer les secteurs d'activité, faire croître l'économie, faire évoluer les sociétés et préserver l'environnement, car seules les meilleures entreprises sont à même d'améliorer la société et le quotidien des individus.
 OBJECTIFS
 En tant qu'équipe Customer eXperience & Solutions (CXS), nous développons des produits, des solutions, un support et des services qui permettent la transformation numérique de nos clients.

 ABOUT US L'équipe de développement, de technologie et d'infrastructure CXS appartient au support et à l'innovation de solutions client (CSI) dans le domaine de l'ingénierie des produits (PE). En tant que leaders du marché de la gestion du cycle de vie des applications et de la prestation de services, nous développons des services automatisés et pilotés par les données basés sur la plateforme SAP Cloud pour prendre en charge le cycle de vie complet de la base de données SAP et de toutes les solutions SAP.
 Notre équipe se concentre sur les applications de services automatisées utilisant SAP CXS Data Lake et AI.

 MISSIONS & RESPONSABILITÉS
 Le système SAP est une entité complexe comprenant des centaines voire des milliers de possibilités de configurations et d'utilisations. Les experts SAP fournissent des procédures de contrôles automatisées permettant de vérifier en continu les systèmes clients pour une configuration et une utilisation optimales au niveau de la base de données et des applicatifs
 L’objectif de la thèse sera de développer de nouveaux algorithmes innovant de contrôle automatisé combinant l’utilisation simultanée de données tant bien structurelles que non structurelles (textuelles).
 Les jeux de données SAP propriétaires fournis seront composés de métriques techniques décrivant la charge de serveurs (utilisation CPU, disque, RAM, etc...) ainsi que leurs configurations sur une durée de plus d'une année provenant de nombreux systèmes et incidents signalés par les clients et des meilleures pratiques, solutions et correctifs fournis par des experts SAP
 EXPÉRIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE

 Connaissance et expérience de Deep Learning
 Connaissance des méthodes NLP est un plus
 Expérience de développement (par exemple : Python, PySpark, PyTorch …)
 Experience avec Docker & Kubernetes
 Solides compétences analytiques, axé sur les résultats, bonnes capacités de réflexion conceptuelle, autonomie
 Capacité à présenter des informations complexes de manière claire et concise

 FORMATION / COMPÉTENCES ET APTITUDES

 Avoir un Master of Science en mathématiques ou en science des données
 Maîtrise de l'anglais, la connaissance du français est un plus
 Conception, formation, validation et analyse des modèles d'apprentissage
 Capacité à effectuer l'évaluation et la sélection des technologies actuelles. 


 CE QUE NOUS AVONS À VOUS OFFRIR
 La clé de la réussite est entre vos mains. Mais chez SAP, nous vous donnons les moyens de façonner votre propre clé.
    Votre carrière chez SAP pourra vous ouvrir de nombreuses portes. Si vous recherchez une entreprise dédiée de vos idées et de votre développement personnel, qui vous reconnaisse pour vos contributions uniques, qui vous anime d'un grand sens du devoir et qui vous accueille dans un environnement de travail informel, flexible et inclusif, n'attendez plus à appliquer chez nous.
   
ENGAGEMENT DE SAP POUR LA DIVERSITÉ


    Pour exploiter toute la puissance de l'innovation, SAP s'emploie à recruter un personnel diversifié. Nous désirons mettre à profit les qualités de tous et valoriser les compétences uniques que chacun apporte à l'entreprise.
  

    SAP s'engage à respecter les principes d'égalité des chances en matière d'emploi et à adapter raisonnablement ses installations à destination des candidats présentant un handicap physique et/ou mental. Si vous avez besoin d'installations spécifiques ou d'une aide particulière pour accéder à notre site Web ou finaliser votre candidature, envoyez un e-mail précisant votre demande à l'équipe Recruiting Operations Team (Amériques : Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com ou Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, zone APJ : Careers.APJ@sap.com, zone EMEA : Careers@sap.com).
    Les candidats retenus feront peut-être l'objet d'une vérification des références menée par un fournisseur externe.
  
 Emplacements Supplémentaires:

We are Covestro. We are curious. We are courageous. We are colorful. We refined Chemical material solutions with game-changing products. Let us empower you to push boundaries. Join us and our 18.150 colleagues now and together we will make the world a brighter place.
WHAT WE OFFER
Our global team in Digital Process Technology & Knowledge Management strives to make most of Covestro’s deep process knowledge and rich production data. Can you make a difference and keep knowledge and data flowing?
As part of our Digital Services group, you have the opportunity to contribute to Covestro’s digital transformation to unlock the full potential of our production facilities. Towards that goal you will develop digital solutions and apply advanced analytic methods to gain new insights by leveraging the steadily growing amount of process data.
YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Support condition monitoring activities to assess sensor, asset and unit health by using and developing digital solutions
Support data-driven use cases to improve efficiency in a production environment by applying state-of-the art advanced analytic methods
Create powerful visuals and dashboards to enable colleagues gaining insights of their data
You will have the opportunity to work on your own subprojects and to discuss your results with the respective experts from our interdisciplinary team
WHAT YOU OFFER
You are an enrolled student (m/f/d) at a university in Engineering, Science, IT or a comparable subject
Expertise in data processing and data analytics through your studies is beneficial
You have experience with programming (e.g. Python) and knowledge on process engineering is a plus
You are able to work independently, solution oriented and have good analytical skills
You are eager to learn, committed and motivated
Good English skills, written and spoken, round off your profile
The internship has a minimum duration of 4 months. We look forward to receiving your online application including a cover letter, your CV, certificates, proof of enrollment, and other relevant documents. Please indicate your earliest start date and preferred duration in your application.
First questions will be answered by Marlis Abdalla (marlis.abdalla@covestro.com).
YOUR APPLICATION
Are you curious, courageous and colorful as we are? If so, we can offer you exciting career opportunities. We look forward to receiving your application including a cover letter, your resume, certificates as well as your salary expectations and your notice period. Become part of our Team - apply now!
Anyone who wants to contribute to a better world with Covestro can also expect a lot.
We want you to feel at home at Covestro. To feel you’re treated fairly and transparently. That means financial security, a healthy work-life balance and generous benefits.
Specifically, it means for us: flexible working hours, the compatibility of family and work, active health promotion and the ability to convert part of your salary into long-term or retirement savings. And that's not all.
Sounds exciting? Find out more about Covestro and our benefits here:
https://www.career.covestro.de/de/about-covestro/covestro-as-an-employer/employee-benefits
Contact Us
Covestro welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of racial or ethnic origin, skin color, nationality, religion, philosophy, gender, age, disability, appearance or sexual identity. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Standort:
Berlin, BE, DE Wildpoldsried, BY, DE
Stellen-ID: 2371
At the earliest date possible we are looking for support for our #teamsonnen
Clean and affordable energy for all is one of the greatest challenges of our time. Headquartered in the Bavarian energy village of Wildpoldsried, sonnen GmbH wants to enable all people to determine their own energy future. That means, among other things, the inexpensive production and storage of renewable energy and the intelligent networking of producers and consumers. sonnen thereby gives people around the world the opportunity to become independent of fossil fuels and conventional energy supplier.
At sonnen, we are building the energy system of the future. An energy system in which electricity is clean and people are the focus. To this end, we are developing new technologies and business models that have not existed before. Whether intelligent power storage, virtual power plants or digital services - we set the trends of a new energy world. This creates space for innovation, creativity, passion and personal development opportunities in a rapidly growing company.
We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist for our Advanced Data Analytics team. The team is a top-level expert team within the technology unit of the sonnen group. In close collaboration with sonnen’s functional units we develop new business and product relevant data analytics and services to serve our customer with smart solution and in-depth advanced business insights.

Your responsibilities
You mine and analyse data from sonnen’s company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
You build and implement solutions that enable operational units to improve quality and speed of core processes in order to generate incremental revenue, reduce expense and risk.
You proactively run analysis and evaluate “proof of concepts” to unlock new advanced data analytic insights, which can be developed into future customer product & service offerings.
You closely collaborate with data architects and engineers within the team, across other technology teams and with business analysts from functional teams across all project phases: ideation, design, development product deployment and sustaining.
Your qualification
You have 2+ years of industry or academic experiences in data science / machine learning with a track record identifying and developing new smart data services and products to optimize processes, products and enhance customer engagement and relationship.
You have preferable a Master’s/Diploma in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or another quantitative field.
You have a in-depth knowledge of a variety of analytics, machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, random forest, artificial neural networks, etc.) and statistics (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.), and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
You are fluent in using statistical computer languages (Python, R, SQL, etc.) to querying databases, manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
You have experiences in working with analytics through the modeling lifecycle including gathering data, design, recommendations, testing, implementation, communication, and revisions.
You like to take responsibility an be solution oriented.
You like to work as part of a strong team and collaborate cross functional with business analyst and stakeholders from other units
You have an open and solution-oriented communication style in English and ideally in German.
You like to thrive in a dynamic environment and successfully deliver on multiple assignments.
You have a drive to make a difference.
You’re interested in renewable energy.
What you can expect:
At sonnen you will experience an international environment in a fast-growing and innovative company in the renewable energy industry sector. Due to our young corporate culture and the short decision-making processes, you can really make a difference with us!
We offer an atmosphere of openness, tolerance and mutual respect. Join us and help us with our vision of clean and affordable energy for all. Share with us the passion for clean energy and new technologies.
If you want to learn more about our benefits, please take a closer look at: Our Benefits
Apply now!
sonnen - energy is yours!

Archives sind das internationale Zentrum über NS-Verfolgung mit dem 
weltweit umfassendsten Archiv zu den Opfern des Nationalsozialismus. Wir sind 
UNESCO-Weltdokumentenerbe. Und wir sorgen dafür, dass die Geschichten von 
Millionen Verfolgten auch in Zukunft eine wesentliche Rolle spielen. 
Die Arolsen Archives halten weit mehr als 100 Millionen Dokumente bereit, meist über 
Schicksale von Einzelpersonen. Eine wichtige Zielsetzung der Arolsen Archives ist, 
Personalien suchbar zu machen. Dafür arbeiten die Arolsen Archives in zahlreichen 
Projekten und Prozessen an der Aufbereitung der Daten und der Verbesserung der 
Datenqualität. Vor allem durch die Indizierung von Metadaten wie Namen, Herkunftsorten, 
Geburtsdaten entsteht eine wachsende Datenbasis für die Recherche in den 
Dokumenten. Und hier kommst Du ins Spiel: 
Als Data Scientist (m/w/d) erwarten Dich folgende Aufgaben:  
Du bist verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Data Management 
Prozessen.  
Du planst und steuerst die Projekte und baust ein bedarfsorientiertes Controlling 
auf.  
Dabei arbeitest Du mit internen und externen Partner*innen zusammen und 
fungierst als direkte*r Ansprechpartner*in für alle Fragen rund um das Data 
Management.  
Zusätzlich baust Du ein Netzwerk aus neuen strategischen Partner*innen für 
künftige Kooperationsprojekte auf und bist der Schlüsselkontakt für 
Technologiepartner*innen.
  


Bad Arolsen, 
25. April 2022





 
Dein Weg zu den Arolsen Archives:  
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich 
Informationstechnologie, Wirtschaftsinformatik mit Schwerpunkt Data-Science 
oder über eine vergleichbare Qualifikation und eine mehrjährige Berufserfahrung 
im entsprechenden Umfeld.  
Du hast Interesse an Themen, mit denen wir uns auseinandersetzen und kannst 
eine erste Grunderfahrung im Archiv vorweisen.  
Du hast Erfahrung in der Koordination von digitalen Arbeitsabläufen mit internen 
und externen Partner*innen und deren Optimierung, am besten im agilen 
Projektmanagement (Scrum, Lean etc.).  
Du bist experimentierfreudig und bringst Verständnis für Datenstrukturen, 
Datenformaten und Datenanalyse mit.  
Grundkenntnisse einer oder mehrerer Programmiersprachen (Phyton, R, o.ä.) 
sind Bestandteil deiner Fachkompetenzen.  
Du willst wirklich etwas bewegen und lebst eine „Hands-On-Mentalität“.  
Du bist motiviert, Dein eigenes Team aufzubauen und kannst bereits erste 
Erfahrung in der Führung von Teams vorweisen.  
Du verfügst über gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch. Weitere 
Sprachkenntnisse freuen uns ebenfalls!  
Du bist kommunikativ, reißt andere Menschen mit Deinen Ideen mit und bist 
selbst unter einer hohen Arbeitsbelastung kreativ und innovativ. 

Mehr als nur ein Arbeitsplatz: 
Du bereicherst uns mit Deiner Expertise. Und wir geben unser Bestes, damit Du Dich bei 
uns wohlfühlst: Denn bei uns stimmt die Balance zwischen Arbeits- und Privatleben. Und 
Du hast die Möglichkeit, in einem internationalen Umfeld tätig zu werden und zusätzlich:  

eine abwechslungsreiche, spannende und vor allem gesellschaftlich relevante 
Aufgabe zu erfüllen,  
aktiv an der Mitgestaltung Deiner Position verantwortlich zu sein.  
Wir sind keine Einzelkämpfer. Unsere Organisationskultur ist teamorientiert, 
geprägt von flachen Hierarchien und einem sehr offenen und kollegialen 
Miteinander.  
Du bestimmst Deinen Arbeitsalltag durch individuelle und flexible 
Arbeitszeitgestaltung.  
Du möchtest vor Ort arbeiten oder doch lieber daheim? Unsere vielfältigen 
Homeoffice Modelle machen es möglich! 

Wir unterstützen mit unserer Arbeit die Anerkennung einer vielfältigen Gesellschaft und 
fördern bei unseren Mitarbeiter*innen Diversität und Inklusion.





 
Vergütung: 
Für unsere Mitarbeiter*innen findet der Tarifvertrag TV AL II*) Anwendung. Dieser 
beinhaltet eine 38,50 Stunden Woche, Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld sowie einen 
Jahresurlaubsanspruch von 30 Arbeitstagen. Die Eingruppierung erfolgt in der 
Gehaltsgruppe C-7a**). 

Beginn: zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt. Es handelt sich um eine unbefristete Anstellung. 

Interessiert? 
Dich hat der Ehrgeiz gepackt und Du willst Teil von etwas Großem sein? Dann schick uns 
Deinen Lebenslauf bis zum 31. Mai 2022 an hr@arolsen-archives.org. Aus 
Sicherheitsgründen akzeptieren wir ausschließlich Bewerbungen im PDF-Format. 
Rückfragen fachlicher Art beantwortet Dir gerne Dr. Achim Link, Abteilungsleiter Prozesse 
und IT, unter achim.link@arolsen-archives.org 

Bei gleicher Eignung werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber*innen (m/w/d) bevorzugt 
berücksichtigt.

Data Analyst / Data Scientist (gn)
Berufserfahrung
IT
Technische Berufe (Sonstige)
Publiziert: 30.03.2022
Über uns
Die Handelsblatt GmbH ist Marktführer im Segment der Wirtschafts- und Finanzpresse. Objekte wie Handelsblatt und WirtschaftsWoche stehen beispielhaft für das hohe Niveau unserer Printtitel. Die Verlagsgruppe Handelsblatt gehört mit zahlreichen Online- und Offline-Produkten zu den Vorreitern auf dem Gebiet der elektronischen Medien. Von der aktuellen Nachricht bis zum fundierten Hintergrundwissen erhalten unsere Leser täglich Informationen mittels unterschiedlicher Medien - von der Zeitung, über Apps bis zum Internet.

Für den Bereich Data & Analytics suchen wir am Standort Düsseldorf baldmöglichst eine:n
Data Analyst/Data Scientist (gn)

Deine Aufgaben
Du analysierst und kontrollierst die Performance unserer digitalen Produkte in den unterschiedlichen Web-, Mobile-, App-, Video- und Social-Media-Kanälen
Du definierst Key Performance Indikatoren und darauf basierte Reports und Analysen, welche zur Steuerung des digitalen Geschäfts und der Produktentwicklung relevant sind
Du baust gemeinsam mit Data Engineers und Data Scientisten eine effiziente (Self-Service)-BI-Infrastruktur und erstellst Dashboards zur Steuerung des digitalen Abogeschäfts
Du führst intensive Datenanalysen durch, interpretierst die Ergebnisse und leitest daraus Handlungsempfehlungen für Produktentwicklung, Redaktion und Vertrieb ab
Du analysierst das Nutzerverhalten in den digitalen Produkten von Handelsblatt und Wirtschaftswoche im Hinblick auf die unterschiedlichen Inhalte und Erlösmodelle
Du entwickelst fortlaufend neue Messmethoden und Analyse-Modelle, evaluierst Technologien und unterstützt die internen Stakeholder bei ihrer Arbeit mit unseren Nutzerdaten
Du begleitest den Release neuer Produkte, erweiterst das Tracking und unterstützt beim Aufsetzen, Durchführen und Auswerten von A/B-Tests
Dein Profil
Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung / ein abgeschlossenes Studium, sodass Du uns im Bereich Analyse tatkräftig unterstützen kannst (Bspw. im Bereich Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Marketing, Mathematik oder auch Informatik)
Du bringst mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Web- und/oder Social-Media-Analyse mit, idealerweise von einem digitalen Verlag/Medienhaus
Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Tableau, sowie Erfahrungen in der Modellierung und Strukturierung von Daten
Du weißt, wie man die gängigen Daten- & Analyse-Tools einsetzt; Kenntnisse in Webtrekk, ATI, Google Analytics und Facebook Insights sind von großem Vorteil
Du hast ein Gefühl für die relevanten KPIs und kannst deren Aussagekraft einschätzen
Du gehst methodisch, lösungsorientiert, sowie eigeninitiativ und strukturiert an Aufgabenstellungen heran, weißt aber gleichzeitig gute Teamarbeit zu schätzen
Du beherrschst es, aus komplexen Sachverhalten Muster zu identifizieren und diese in einer verständlichen Form aufzubereiten und zu kommunizieren
Wir bieten
Eine faire und leistungsorientierte Vergütung
Ein angenehmes und modernes Arbeitsumfeld
Mobiles Arbeiten
Gute Sozialleistungen (wie z.B. 30 Tage Urlaub pro Jahr, Zuschuss zu VL/BAV, vergünstigte Firmentickets, Unterstützung bei der Kinderbetreuung, Maßnahmen zur betrieblichen Gesundheitsförderung, attraktive Vergünstigungen bei vielen Kooperationspartnern)
Individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Isabelle Mathes freut sich auf deine Bewerbung und steht dir für Fragen gern zur Verfügung.
Frau Isabelle Mathes
HR Business Partner

post_title: Werkstudent (w/m/d) - Data Scientist / BI Analyst for Enterprise Analytics - Cloud Infrastructure
description:
Wir helfen die Welt zu verbessern
 Unsere Unternehmenskultur schafft die Voraussetzungen, damit unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter ihr Innovationspotenzial entfalten und gemeinsam bahnbrechende Neuerungen entwickeln können. Wie erreichen wir dieses Ziel? Wir konzentrieren uns jeden Tag darauf, die Zukunft mitzugestalten und einen Arbeitsplatz zu schaffen, an dem Vielfalt und Flexibilität wertgeschätzt werden und der mit unserer Vision und zukunftsorientierten Arbeitsweise im Einklang steht. Wir legen größten Wert auf partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und gegenseitige Unterstützung im Team sowie auf Lernen und Entwicklung. Persönliche Beiträge werden anerkannt, und Sie haben die Wahl zwischen verschiedenen Zusatzleistungen. Bewerben Sie sich jetzt.
 ÜBER DAS TEAM
 Das Enterprise Analytics (EA) Team implementiert und betreibt die analytische Datenbasis für ganz SAP und stellt damit sicher, dass Daten harmonisiert, standardisiert und aus einer Quelle verteilt werden. Die Daten und Analysen liefern Erkenntnisse und unterstützen die Entscheidungsprozesse in vielen strategischen und operationalen Prozessen.

 Innerhalb von EA ist das Entwicklungsteam Cloud Infrastructure Capacity Management verantwortlich für die Implementierung von Reporting and Planungsapplikationen im Bereich von Cloud Management. Die Ergebnisse des Teams tragen direkt dazu bei den TCO, die Data Center Utilization, die Demand Forecast Accuracy, das top-level company steering, die Provisioning, und viele mehr zu verbessern und weiterzuentwickeln. Wir leisten damit einen direkten Beitrag zur übergeordneten SAP Strategie.

 Unser Team bietet eine Vielzahl von Qualifikationen und Lernmöglichkeiten. Während einige von uns Experten für BW/IBP und HANA-Modellierung / SQL sind, bietet unser Team auch Einblicke in die Geschäftsdynamik und -prozesse, die durch unsere Datenbeschaffung und Visualisierungen unterstützt werden.

 Das Team ist sehr empathisch, divers und arbeitet verteilt über mehrere Lokationen wie Ratingen & Walldorf & Indien & Romania.

 DIE ROLLE
 Als hochmotivierte Person erhalten unsere neuen Werkstudenten die Möglichkeit, selbstständig an größeren Data Science, Planungs- und BI-Projekten zu arbeiten und verschiedene Interessensgebiete zu erkunden.

 Datenmodelle und KPIs werden analysiert und eigenständig vorangetrieben. Hierzu werden SAP Technologie und Produkte herangezogen und angewendet.

 Wir bieten flexible Wochenarbeitszeiten: 20 Std

 ROLLENANFODERUNGEN


 Student (f/m) technischen Hochschule/Universität oder ähnlichem
 Fokus auf Data Science / BI
 Skills in HANA / SQL ist ein Plus
 Wissen und Interesse an der Verarbeitung von Massendaten
 SCRUM
 Strukturierte analytische Arbeitsweise
 Hochmotiviert eigenständig an großen Projekten mitzuarbeiten
 Deutsch und Englisch fließend

 Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen sollten neben einem Anschreiben, tabellarischen Lebenslauf, aktuellem Notenspiegel und gültiger Immatrikulationsbescheinigung auch Kopien von Zwischen-, Schulabschluss- und, soweit vorhanden, Arbeitszeugnissen (Praktika) als Anlagen enthalten. Beschreiben sie bitte außerdem Ihre Erfahrungen und Kenntnisse in Fremdsprachen und Computerprogrammen / Programmiersprachen.

 #Workingstudent #Werkstudent #Internship #Praktikum #Germany #Deutschland #Student

 Wir stellen uns Herausforderungen gemeinsam


 SAP-Innovationen helfen mehr als 400.000 Kunden weltweit, effizienter zusammenzuarbeiten und Business Insight effektiver zu nutzen. SAP war ursprünglich für seine Führungsrolle in der ERP-Software (Enterprise Resource Planning) bekannt und hat sich zu einem Marktführer für End-to-End-Software für Geschäftsanwendungen und zugehörige Services für Datenbank, Analyse, intelligente Technologien und Erfahrungsmanagement entwickelt. Als Cloud-Unternehmen mit 200 Millionen Benutzern und mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeitern weltweit sind wir zielgerichtet und zukunftsorientiert, mit einer äußerst kollaborativen Teamethik und Engagement für die persönliche Entwicklung. Unabhängig davon, ob wir globale Branchen, Menschen oder Plattformen miteinander verbinden, stellen wir sicher, dass jede Herausforderung die Lösung erhält, die sie verdient. Bei SAP schaffen wir gemeinsam Durchbrüche.
 Inklusion führt uns zum Erfolg
 In unserer Kultur der Inklusion stehen Gesundheit und Wohlbefinden im Mittelpunkt. Flexible Arbeitsmodelle sorgen dafür, dass sich jede und jeder – unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund – eingebunden fühlt und Bestleistungen erbringen kann. Wir bei SAP sind davon überzeugt, dass wir durch die einzigartigen Fähigkeiten und Qualitäten, die jede und jeder in unser Unternehmen einbringt, stärker werden. Wir investieren in unsere Mitarbeitenden, um ihr Selbstvertrauen zu stärken und ihnen dabei zu helfen, ihr volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Wir setzen auf die Förderung aller Talente, um eine bessere und gerechtere Welt zu schaffen. SAP ist stolz darauf, als Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit einzustehen und diese aktiv zu fördern. Wir sind den Grundsätzen der Chancengleichheit im Beruf verpflichtet. Für Bewerberinnen und Bewerber mit physischen und/oder psychischen Beeinträchtigungen treffen wir geeignete Vorkehrungen. Wenn Sie an einer Bewerbung bei SAP interessiert sind und beim Navigieren auf unserer Website oder beim Ausfüllen der Bewerbung Unterstützung benötigen, senden Sie eine E-Mail mit Ihrer Anfrage an das Recruiting Operations Team in der jeweiligen Region: Careers@sap.com. SAP Mitarbeiter:innen: Kandidat:innen können nur für unbefristete Stellen empfohlen werden – weitere Regelungen findet Ihr in der SAP Referral Policy. Für Ausbildungsstellen können spezielle Regelungen Anwendung finden.
 Chancengleichheit im Beruf: Minderheit/Geschlecht/Veteranenstatus/Behinderung
 Qualifizierte Bewerber werden unabhängig von Alter, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, Religion, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht (einschließlich Schwangerschaft, Entbindung usw.), sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder -ausdruck, geschütztem Veteranenstatus oder Behinderung für eine Beschäftigung berücksichtigt.
 Requisition ID:330924 | Funktionsbereich:Sekretariat / Assistenz | Reisetätigkeit:0 - 10% | Karrierestatus:Studenten | Anstellungsverhältnis:Teilzeit, befristet | Weitere Standorte #LI-Hybrid

 We are SAP
 SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

 Our inclusion promise 
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. Data Scientist - Technologies & Platforms (m/f/d)
Heidelberg
Bilfinger Digital Next GmbH is an internationally operating technology start-up headquartered in Heidelberg. By the unique combination of state-of-the-art technologies in the field of IIoT (e.g. AI, Big Data Analytics, Machine Learning or Digital Twin) and market knowledge of many years we develop innovative, data-driven business models to support our customers in the process industry in their digital transformation. Our company consists of skilled experts from the fields of IT, OT, Software Engineering, Data Science, Consulting and Business Development.
You are enthusiastic about working in an entrepreneurial start-up environment at the frontier of digital transformation and are willing to drive new initiatives? Join our team and become the next #digitalfrontrunner.
WHAT WE EXPECT
Data exploration and analysis, development and operation of ML-models and algorithms in the course of customer projects
Support our consultants with you knowledge of data science methods and drive new innovative solutions in customer projects
Contribution to the constant improvement of our methods and tech-stack
REQUIREMENTS
Academic degree in a quantitative discipline like Computer or Data Science, Engineering, Economics, Physics etc.
At least two years of professional experience in the field of Data Analytics and/or Data Science
Strong Python knowledge and corresponding programming skills
Familiarity with common ML-frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc. and first practical experience with Deep Learning, Computer Vision and Object Detection is a plus
Ideally experience with Microsoft Azure as well as initial practical experience with MLOps tools and processes
Analytical thinking and an accurate and structured working style as well as an eye for details and synergies
Ability to perform at the highest level even under demanding conditions
Ability to interact and communicate with individuals at different levels of the organization (German and English)
Proactive thinking and the flexibility to deal with different cultures and attitudes
Strong affinity with software tools and scripts
WHAT WE OFFER

Attractive, innovative and friendly working environment to grow with a successful start-u
Professionally challenging work as well as steep learning curve because of a large number of innovative projects
Great office right nearby Heidelberg train station (Heidelberg Bahnstadt)
Training and development opportunities, team events
Flexible working concept – flexible working hours and work place
Fresh fruits and free drinks
For further information please contact Ms. Laura Schulz via laura.schulz@bilfinger.com.

info_remote: Machine Learning Reply - 609 reviews - Wien, W
description:
At Machine Learning Reply Austria we strive to work on leading-edge data science projects with our clients for which we are seeking Data Science consultants with a strong technical background.

Machine Learning Reply, with its sister companies in Italy and Germany and over 8500 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We are a tight knit, laid back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in community of practice with our tech partners.

We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Data Science area that cover the entire project life cycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing and modeling using machine learning algorithms.

We have extensive expertise in the broad Data Science spectrum in all key industries of the German HDAX-companies. With focus on open source and cloud technologies we enable our customers to successfully introduce and implement new data-driven solutions and to optimize already existing processes and products.

Tasks

You are responsible for customised end-to-end solutions in the field of data science that cover the entire project cycle at the customer. Data architecture, infrastructure topics or quality assurance with machine learning algorithms are your passion.


You identify and analyse problem solutions and discuss them with the customer. You propose effective solutions
Use your innovative spirit and develop state-of-the-art algorithms, implement them and automate workflows together with your colleagues, data scientists and/or machine learning specialists
You always stay on the cutting edge of technology and work together with market-leading technology companies

Requirements


A degree in (business) computer science, mathematics, physics or business administration and relevant professional experience in the industry
Sound knowledge of necessary languages (Python or R), machine learning and statistics, ideally with expertise in at least one of the relevant areas, e.g. NLP, recommender systems, time series, computer vision
Experience in prioritising customer needs and creating business value solutions or applications
Excellent English skills, good German skills and you are willing to travel nationwide if required by the projec

Benefits


We offer you for this position according to the collective agreement for employees in data processing and information technology a gross monthly salary of at least € 3215 (Consultant) or € 4286 (Senior Consultant) depending on your previous experience
Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange
Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries)
Office space in downtown Vienna with access to Stammstrecke
Training and certification encouraged
Home-office contracts
State of the art work equipment
Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience
Public transport ticket within Vienna
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office and remote work

Job Description:
Would you like to join us in an exciting position in Manufacturing Technology & Science (MTS) which is Ferring’s global Centre of Expertise for aseptic and solid/non-sterile manufacturing technologies, analytics and primary packaging? We support manufacturing sites all over the world in verifying and continuously improving process and analytical technologies to ensure compliance and effective supply of products to our patients. We are also responsible for the manufacturing launch of new products from development and for driving manufacturing innovation projects. We offer a challenging job in an international company with great development possibilities, and where your contributions will be valuable and make a difference.
The job
As Data Scientist you will be part of a global team supporting the entire manufacturing network and your overall focus is to extract insights from data which enable the organization to make data-driven decisions and improve company’s performance.
As Data Scientist, you lead projects related to data analysis and modeling with a strong focus on innovation, quality enhancement and cost reduction. You interact with project teams and manufacturing process experts to contextualize the data and acquire process knowledge. You participate to projects as a data expert to solve business and research questions through statistical analysis. You promote, by training and coaching your colleagues, leveraging data in all company’s areas.
Your essential responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Identify and lead project opportunities to leverage and promote the use of data (e.g. quality improvement, cost reduction).
Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to progress data science projects (e.g. business customers, IT, OT)
Collect data and make sure to access relevant data sources.
Select, develop and assess the performance of data models. Document model development (reports, custom code test and review) and validate it according to established standards.
Transfer of model from development to production.
Provide “on-demand” support for data driven decisions: within project teams, define business/research questions and execute data analysis enabling a rationale/fact-based decision making.
Identify data science related training needs for stakeholders within Ferring. Create training content and courses. Provide training and/or supervise the execution of training provided by external partners.
Collaborate in establishing standards (SOP) and best-practice guidance documents to ensure state of the art data science within Technical Operations
Maintain a collaboration network with data science stakeholders within and outside your department (R&D, IT, OT)
Qualifications
We expect the ideal candidate to have below qualifications:
Scientific University Master’s degree with focus in Data Science or equivalent experience acquired in job
Past experience in Data Science, preferably applied to pharmaceutical manufacturing
Experience in the following fields appreciated: Process Analytical Technology, NIR/RAMAN spectroscopy, IT or OT (management of data, computer network architecture, code review, validation, deployment). Pharma or non-pharma experience welcome.
Proficient in Statics, Data Analysis and Machine Learning (including Deep Learning)
Coding languages for data management and data science applications (Python, SQL)
Good working knowledge of manufacturing, GMP, and FDA requirements
Project management experience
Language: English (fluent, speaking & writing)
Flexibility to travel
Leadership skills
Self-starter and independent
Action oriented and pragmatic
Customer focused
Patient and determined
Diplomatic, easy-going personality
Will for continuous learning, will to share knowledge, train and coach others
Your new workplace is at the Ferring International Pharma-Science Center (IPC) in our spectacular and state-of-the-art new domicile, a landmark located next to “Den Blå Planet”, near Copenhagen Airport.
Contact and application
Please send your application and CV no later than 20 May 2022. If you have any questions you are very welcome to contact Michele Panzitta, Director Manufacturing Innovation and Pilot Plant
at +41 (0) 763296322
Please note that we review applications on an on-going basis and close the process when we find the right match – the sooner you apply the better are your chances.
Ferring Pharmaceuticals is a leader in reproductive medicine and maternal health, and in specialty areas within gastroenterology and urology. At Ferring International PharmaScience Center (IPC) in Copenhagen we are nearly 600 people, primarily scientists and specialists working to break new land to help people live better lives. We focus our R&D efforts on peptide-based drugs and biotechnology derived medicines.
As a privately-owned company we benefit from the privilege to think and work with a long-term horizon. You will experience the same freedom in your search for new solutions. Your desire to innovate and explore will contribute to fulfilling our ambition of becoming the world’s leading company within reproductive medicine and maternal health. If you need help, you will find it. If you want challenges, they are right in front of you. If you are looking for freedom to find your own way, you are trusted to do so. If you want to make a mark in the world for the better, you feel just like the rest of us. Read more at ferring.com.
Location:
Ferring Denmark

Job Description
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join ING. This team is at the heart of ING, and its systems and algorithms are involved in the large scale of customer interactions. Your eagerness to learn is not only visible in the technical areas but also in how you develop your interpersonal skills. As a creative and curious Data Scientist, you are looking forward to solving a wide variety of real-world business problems. On top of this, you have the programming skills to write quality code that works in production. Machine learning, personalization, and analytics are at the core of what we do. We are looking for experienced data scientists to help us build the next generation of customer interaction experience at ING. Sounds interesting? Please read further.
What you'll do
You’re always thinking one step ahead, for example in advising about the best way of implementation.
You are able to look at things from a different perspective and you are keen on making original solutions work in real-life. Next to being creative, you are also persistent.
If the problem is hard to crack or a technical solution hard to introduce, you keep trying different approaches until you succeed.
You enjoy working in cross-functional teams with ambitious goals, asking fellow team members for assistance, but also helping them out by sharing your knowledge and capabilities.
You have solid communication skills that enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization.
Your enthusiasm and passion are contagious, mobilizing people to capture the tremendous value that Data Science brings to customers of ING.
How to succeed
At least 1 year of relevant applied experience
MSc or Ph.D. with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields
Experience in working in an Agile/Scrum way would be great
Machine Learning: Deep Learning, Classification, Regression, Clustering, Text Mining. You have an excellent understanding of Neural Networks, Random Forests, Logistic Regression, SVM, KNN, K-Means, LDA, etc. Experience with model validation is a plus
Programming Languages and Tools: python, Git, PyCharm, Shell scripting or similar. Web development is a nice-to-have
Analytics tooling: pySpark, Hadoop, SQL, Netezza, Jupyter Notebook or similar. Working with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Tensorflow) is a nice-to-have
Analytical and content strength (in DS work field): sees which DS techniques apply to the business problem at hand and is able to structure the approach. Writes readable, concise and efficient code
Willingness to learn: open to feedback and development on both technical and interpersonal levels
Perseverance: does not give up when a problem is demanding, knows how to deal with setbacks
Strong communication skills: written and spoken English needs to be convincing. Active on social media about data science is a nice-to-have
Entrepreneurial skills: takes ownership and makes it happen
What we offer
A job from 36 to 40 hours in a challenging environment where you use the latest technology to make an impact. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, these are some of the benefits of working at ING:
Ambition to become the best Data Scientist team (in Banking)
Great salary and other terms
National or global career possibilities
Great mix in research, strategic, operational & entrepreneurial assignments
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best
Based in Amsterdam, of course in “hybrid mode”, working from home and office as best fits the nature of the work.
Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Can you identify with this profile? Then apply and become a Data Scientist at ING.
As part of your application, we kindly request that you upload a document with a sample of your code, this is necessary for us to be able to assess your application. Please note that for this role no Relocation Package is provided.
About us
With around 52,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a diﬀerence. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. If you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

Our Team:

Is a cross-functional Data team made up of data scientists, data and software architects, software engineers and business reporting analysts spanning the globe
Works on analytics project based on the company's business requirements on different domain such as NLP and time series prediction and analysis
Has ownership over data company-wide, from analytics to global business reporting
Manages the entire data lifecycle from extraction to visualization
Works in SQL, Python, R, scikit-learn, Google Cloud BigQuery, Java and C++ and are always prototyping new technologies

Who You Are:

You’re looking for an opportunity to work with great people in energetic and open company culture. You enjoy collaborating across many different disciplines within a company to help drive towards a common goal. You’re as passionate about building efficient solutions and driving high-level impact to the business. You’re curious about what makes a company succeed; to you, data is not just the answer, but a means to ask more questions.

You Will:

Build statistical, predictive, and machine learning models
Collection, review, perform cleansing and reporting of data
Help our Marketing, Strategy, Product, Sales, Customer Service, and Trading teams drive growth in the business
Develop data-oriented solutions to help solve complex business problems
Create reporting and visualizations and educate the company on your findings
Take part in planning sessions, where we develop use cases and requirements for analytical solutions based on data

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor, Master’s or Ph.D. degree (Statistics, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a related field preferred)
Experience using Python, SQL, databases, and visualization tools
Experience in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing
Experience in time series modeling, developing custom algorithms, and Machine Learning
Familiarity with GCP, AWS, Azure, Docker, or Kubernetes
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills in English

Nice To Have:

Experience with Big Data technologies (such as Spark), and unstructured data
Proficient with data analysis and modeling software such as R

Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

About this opportunity
We are now looking for RAN Data Scientist to join the team in Kista, Sweden. You will join a highly motivated team with expert knowledge in the blend of Radio Network and Data Science. You will have a great opportunity to grow and evolve your own skills and know-how working with state-of-the-art RAN AI solutions.
The Base Band Analytics section is a Radio Access Network (RAN) System organization responsible for driving the RAN AI product development targeting the Ericsson 4G/LTE and 5G/NR RAN Products. The responsibility and focus are on identifying and developing RAN solutions applying Machine Learning techniques and driving the RAN AI evolution to enable the integration of these technologies into the 4G and 5G products. It also includes spreading and growing the AI competence within the Development Organization and to facilitate data-driven development. The Analytics section is also responsible for the Smartphone Lab Program, supporting Ericsson's business and the product development by providing industry-unique and customer-relevant insights based on analysis of current and future end-user applications.

What you will do
Understand, adapt and apply machine learning and AI techniques to provide Radio Access Network solutions and functionality.
Define and conduct RAN product development studies with a focus on solutions based on Machine Learning/AI modeling and support the implementation into the 4G and 5G Radio Network and Network Management products
Use, maintain and evolve RAN simulation environments and AI tools for the development and evaluation of machine learning and AI solutions in the RAN context
Perform lab and live network data analysis to understand the RAN functional behavior to identify and develop RAN solutions and for Machine Learning/AI modeling

You will bring
M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering / Engineering Physics / Wireless communication systems, or equivalent
Deep understanding of Mobile Network and Radio Access technologies in general and LTE and 5G in particular,
Deep understanding of the Physical Layer, RRM, or Traffic Control (L1, L2, L3) of 4G and 5G
Deep understanding of AI and ML techniques, theoretical as well as practical
Have good programming skills (e.g. Java, C++, Python)
Experience in using AI/ML tools and IT systems
Good analytical and data mining skills
Practical experience from RAN Product Development in System Design and Concept Development roles

Application
As the selection process and interviews are ongoing, we encourage you to send your application in English as soon as you can. Placement in Stockholm, Sweden. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Sofia Kolbovich at sofia.kolbovich@ericsson.com. Note that we cannot process applications sent via email.

Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

Prototyping advance analytics and machine learning solutions and optimise iteratively for business partners
Work with key stakeholders and partners to implement solution
Make intelligent approximations to the model if required to make it scalable and operatable
Partner with IT to put machine learning models into production
Evaluate machine learning algorithm and models, and provide technical recommendations to business units for decision making
Drive knowledge sharing and improvement in analytics skills across Digital Streams and relevant business units
Recommend and implement the development path of capabilities and skillsets to foster a culture of applying data & insight driven culture in decision making
Monitor data science products performance to ensure its business values are delivered as per designed, and initiate necessary corrective actions
Requirements
Preferably master degree (or equivalent education qualifications) in Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, Operation Research, Statistics, Behavioural Science or related disciplines Minimal 5 years’ work experience in data science, with proven track record of delivering data science solutions to drive business impact. Experience in Python & Spark is a must
Experience in ASW cloud stack is highly preferred
Experience in digital and multichannel marketing is highly preferred
Advanced analytical skills, experience in recommending appropriate algorithms and methodologies for problem-solving and decision making, leveraging both logic and creativity
Able to keep track of latest analytics technology and concepts, trends of platform & tools
Strong in managing time and multiple projects with a continuous improvement mind set
Experience in visualisation and wrangling tools such as Qliksense, PowerBI, and Alteryx an advantage
Sound communication skills to work with business partners of different levels and background. Be able to articulate ideas verbally and in written forms
Personal & Application Information
Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.

Please note that with effect from 1 June 2022 onwards, all Cathay employees and contractors who work in Cathay City and all other Cathay Group Company premises in Hong Kong must have received a third dose of COVID 19 vaccine. Being tested regularly for COVID-19 is not an option. Consideration will be given to those who are unable to get vaccinated for valid medical reasons.

You will be part of the growing Data team working together with fellow Data Scientists, Data Engineers and ML Engineers to support different functional departments in the Functional Office in Hong Kong, as well as our offices across Southeast Asia and Latin America. You will be responsible for designing and modeling of data-driven solutions used for making our products, services and operations more efficient and intelligent. You will work on variety of challenges including Dynamic Pricing, Order Allocation, ETA, and many others you will help identify and resolve. The ideal candidate will have a passion for generating value out of data.
   



What you'll do

 Gather data requirements from business stakeholders and develop impactful analytics solutions to support business growth and decision making. Collaborate with Business Intelligence Engineering team to build data sources for subsequent analytics Analyse complex datasets to make decisions and create reports as well as visualizations to drive data insights Develop scalable algorithms and models on business problems (i.e. predictive models, clustering, logistic regression and machine-learning algorithms)





What you'll need

 Educational background in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics At least 2 years of working experience (Fresh graduate demonstrating strong potential in analytics will be also considered for junior position) Proven hands-on experience in Tableau Solid experience with Python and SQL Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry Ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges in an enterprise environment Fluency in spoken English and Cantonese

Johnson & Johnson Enterprise Supply Chain’s Digital & Analytics group requires qualified, skilled and experienced data engineers who can handle large volumes of data stored in different storage systems in the supply chain data management team. Suitable candidates should be able to identify the required data for any given operation and build a pipeline for extracting the data and identify computing resource needs to process them.
We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist who will be a machine learning expert to drive the implementation playbook of our machine learning / deep learning / NLP / AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a sound experience on machine learning & entrepreneur mindset, excellent communication skills, proven track record of leadership, comfortable in interfacing with different stake holders, a passionate change agent and should constantly keep pace with industry trends and emerging technologies. Candidate should have a passion for conceptualization, prototyping, debugging & developing ML-based products, applications & solutions.
In this role you will:
Partner with business teams to understand the problem statement, identify the different stake holders and quantify the benefits to the business of the solution under development.
Design, develop and deploy ML-based solutions across various business groups
Drive solution development through identification of right approach, algorithm, techniques & strategy.
Work with business teams to identify the source of data, ingestion strategy preprocessing needs and building the ML model / algorithms considering computing power, time and the business value of the data.
Partner across multiple operating segments including application development to realize the analytics vision
Collaborate across the J&J matrix to define and deliver ML based algorithms / solutions
Provide technical and thought leadership for the development of ML-based algorithms / solutions
Willing to undertake domestic or international travel as required by the projects.

Qualifications
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (Uncompromised requirements for the role): (Include any required computer skills, certifications, licenses, languages, etc.)
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in IT or related Engineer field is required.
Passion to learn and solve problems in a fast-paced environment
At least 6+ years of work experience as a Data Scientist.
Strong math skills (e.g., statistics, algebra) and aptitude
Expertise in Programming languages – Python.
Experience with Python library such as scikit-learn, tensorflow, pytorch, keras.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Experience in data mining
Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau) and cloud providers like Azure, AWS, GCP is a plus
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Solid logical reasoning in feature selection, correlation of features, modelling techniques required
With little supervision, must be able to define, shape, and drive projects to completion.
Expert level in Python and R programming language with ability to write production quality code.
Expert in Machine Learning techniques
Good experience in Deep Learning techniques with minimum 2 years of experience in working on deep learning projects.
Are you ready to impact the world?

Experience in quick resume and LinkedIn profiles screening

Strong written and verbal communication including PowerPoint presentations.

Why should you apply?

Gain recognition for your knowledge and leadership.
Network with other top-notch mentors.
Earn additional income.
Contribute to a vibrant, global student community.
Stay updated on the latest in cutting-edge technologies.
